comment: Tests are about as short as high school tests (30-40) so make sure you know everything because each question counts for more points than normal. never touches or read the textbook. Good hearted professor, but the material can get boring from time to time and you'll want to leave class early.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Maslov was just average in my opinion. Didn't think much of the class and still came out with an A. Lots of others in the class liked him though so he's a solid choice if you have to take the class.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Take this man!! When I first registered, his reviews kind of concerned me. But, I am SO glad i stuck with him!!! He is very nice and you can learn a lot from his lectures if you pay attention! He responds quickly to emails if you have any questions. You MUST take/study the practice tests he gives you!!! As long as you do that, you will be fine!

Business stat is a hard course, no other way to put it. But with maslov he helps you in every way possible the course consist of 3 test and a excel project and a final that can inly improve your grade if you are happy with your grade you don't have to take the final. He is quick to respond to emails and will work with you 1 on 1.

Great choice! Very nice guy and cares a lot about his class and about his students. Stat is a difficult class, so you need to study. Only graded on 3 midterms and 1 assignment. Attendance is not mandatory but I advise you to go to class. Buy the book, it can help you and do the practice sets he posts.

Professor Maslov is very knowledgeable, passionate, and caring. He does not require to buy the book, or attend his class, & posts his lecture notes on D2L. 3 midterms (similar to his problem sets) worth 30% or a final worth 90% & an easy assignment - 10%. Go to his lectures, do the practice problems, study his notes & you will be ok. Recommend!

Professor Maslov did not teach the material well at all. If you take his class make sure to go to tutoring starting at day one. The tutors explain it better than he can. If you do take this class go to class everyday so you can get extra credit for attendance. Believe it or not you will need the extra credit at the end of the semester.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Maslov was a good professor with a strong Russian accent. His grading scale is very generous (ex. 85-100 is an A, 75-84 is a B, etc.). His lectures are very knowledge-based and direct, however, his lectures alone will not help you pass his tests. He provides LOTS of practice problems which really help on tests, and the book helps too.

He knows what he is talking about . He comes in to class with nothing and lectured based on knowledge . He is very open to helping students who dont understand . He puts all the practice problems and PowerPoints online which helps a lot . Grading system is amazing because it you get an 85 you get an A ! Will definitely take him again .
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Maslov is a good professor. Most of his tests are concept based, so that part of the test is easy to study on your own(book & d2l practice). In class he focuses on the harder to solve questions that are not easily solvable through process-of-elimination like in the concepts. Go to class & READ! youll get an A with his grading scale!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Maslov's Business Statistics class wasn't so bad. Stats is hard to me, he isn't the best at explaining things, and sometimes makes you feel dumb for the questions you have. His grading scale is generous; 70-84 is a B. His test's are pretty easy ; do the online sets and you'll be fine. I rarely went to class and got 75s on his tests. Optional final.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Maslov was a great choice and I enjoyed his class. I should have done better than a B, but didnt feel like taking the final. His grading scale is great if your not good at statsticis, I really reccomend taking him because of his generous grading scale. Just do the practice problems and go to class and you should be fine on the tests.
He is a great guy and his teaching style of long and bulky lectures may work for some, but I struggled to keep up from day one.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: He is an extremely nice guy, but it is a very difficult class. He does not explain things well enough for you to understand. I am a straight A student and did very poor in his class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Not a bad teacher, just lectures way too fast. It can also be hard to understand his Russian accent at times. Only grades are 3 tests and 1 project.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Maslov's class was interesting to say the least. He is a very nice guy, but he made his class pretty hard. That being said, he is still one of the better options for 2300 at KSU. The final was worth 40%, and it was cumulative; it was also mostly conceptual though. He also has a pretty big curve for your overall grades. Overall he is okay.

Really nice guy. It's a hard class and requires a good bit of studying, but I overall isn't bad. I was borderline A/B going into the final and I thought I did terrible, but I finished with an A. He has regular office hours so if you're willing to put the work in, take him.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Great professor, super nice, always trying to help students anyway possible to help pass. Tests are fair especially if you do the practice problems. Overall great

This class isnt easy, but he definitely is one of the nicest professors Ive ever had. He says you dont have to get the book, but I recommend it. Just do the problem sets and study his PowerPoints/read the book and you will be fine. This is just one of those classes that takes effort.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS
